column5: It's been a tough week with work and weather so I haven't fished much, but I got out last night and we went 2/2 in under two hours. The weather is back to being terrible so I thought I'd make a video out of it. Both fish were caught on Shadzillas which have become my favourite bait this year. And yes I know my net sucks haha, I just spent $1000 on a new shark fishing set up so I need to delay the net expense to next year. Let me know what you think on the fish/video!
Well I know what I'm doing in the morning.  Heading to the bait store and grabbing a Shadzilla.  Well done
Outstanding!
Right on man!  Beauty muskie!
nice! Where are all the other boats though? Everytime I fish that spot there is a line up! I guess fishing the evening gives some privacy
Nice fishing boys  I've been looking at getting some shadzillas.... They look great
The winds on this day were 30km/h with gusts of 45 until 330pm. I think that must have deterred everyone from going out. They were SW winds though so this spot was protected for the most part
ya if I see winds like that I definitely make the 3 hour drive to the  Kawarthas rather than the 3 hour drive to St. Clair...man Guelph sucks for distance to my favourite fishing holes
Beauty, good for u, that's one fish I never was able to catch :tease:but that's not surprising
I highly recommend it man. Not only do they work really well but they also take less of a toll of your body than throwing pounders all day. Much lighter and you don't need to work them as much.
Nice going! Wow!
Cool vids. just checked out your page. Well done !
Nice to see people out on the water still. Great catch!
Thanks guys. Hoping to get out and film a few more times in the next few weeks before it gets too cold. I want to get a 50 on film!!
Hope so too.  Good luck
Nicely done! I was hoping to hit LSC this year, but haven't been able to make it happen - good to see some solid muskie being caught!
Nice fish(s)  I really like your boat set up amazingly stable can you tell abut about it please Cheers Peter
Great video bud!
It's nothing special, just a 13 ft Boston Whaler. Small but gets the job done.
Watching this I need to #1 - extend Autumn by about 10 more days a year so I can #2 - head back down to St. Clair again.  Good fishing and tips.
Thank you! Heading out for a few hours later today to see if I can put a few more in the boat
